revised_title: Climatic Variability in the North Atlantic Region: Evolution of Cold Stages
tldr: This article discusses the evidence for climatic conditions during the cold stages of the Quaternary period in the North Atlantic region. It examines the definition and history of cold stages, the biological and physical evidence for these climates, and the challenges of interpreting them. The article also reviews the record of climatic change based on periglacial phenomena and fossil floras and faunas, and considers the problems of interpreting cold-stage climates.
